document.title: FY24 Agricultural and Envrionmental Systems Career Field Content Standards

612C7C46293442D38863D1B002798B5C.description: Identify ways parks, recreation, and associated professions promote inclusivity across abilities, cultures, and life stages.

1F93AB3DB03F49A6BEDD6FD3B0390413.description: Describe the ways parks, recreation, and associated professions promote economic development in their communities.

4089832EC18E42568A05E00CD68A6534.description: Identify and describe individual, organizational, and community barriers that can impede engagement in leisure, play, and recreation.

65773C387B5F4FFC8C2FE992638B584B.description: Identify and describe the leisure needs and opportunities of community that can be facilitated through parks and recreation management.

233E560F6CB546EDBB4C29B544E0C198.description: Identify the relationship between a variety of cultural identities (e.g. age, ability, economic class, gender, race, ethnicity) and recreation participation.

016E43C390154795B7EF4B5E33025044.description: Identify and describe the nature and scope of park, recreation, tourism, or related professions and their associated industries.

999D404D161B471696C2632728DA5F59.description: Identify and describe legislative and historical events that have significantly impacted leisure, play, and recreation in the United States.

4389805A5CD5448EAF3BA7EB4E6603B6.description: Identify and describe theories (e.g. flow theory, Csikszentmihalyi, etc.) and how they may be applied to leisure, play, and recreation.

3E13C7F4A8254B8580F5DF345AA07ACD.description: Identify and describe the principal concept of leisure (Time, Activity, and State of Mind).

6A9E2348BF8E452BA465693D0B9F6872.description: Parks and Recreational Management: Demonstrate a basic understanding of the foundation of the park and recreation profession and their associated industries in history, theory, science, and philosophy.

84C62B6483E847E4938DCD240845824C.description: Implement habitat restoration and sustainability management plan environmental practices.

12FB37E37E014133A642FD4B324918AB.description: Develop a management plan for the restoration and sustainability of a specific habitat using environmental practices that enhance biological diversity.

BC93FE01130C432483478BE972047461.description: Implement techniques used in habitat management, mitigation, enhancement, and restoration.

980A3E04998B4B2A832AE0DCA4EA14F3.description: Explain the role of various stakeholders, including individuals, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), corporations, and governments in habitat restoration and conservation.

F699F69707EB475B9076ED197B70B5A3.description: Survey and monitor species within a habitat.

6E771078F5BE4B84BC416465A2E634F2.description: Identify and diﬀerentiate extinct, endangered, extirpated, threatened, and species of concern.

DCA496FC1DB84C0B9C7452EE88FE223E.description: Evaluate the current and historical (e.g., industrialism, agriculture, climate change) impacts of human interactions on ecosystems and habitats.

2C1CBF7568C443EA9C0FAFB27BD135F0.description: Examine sites and place them into ecological classifications.

40D259EC681E493485937FD73F117A9A.description: Diﬀerentiate the properties and characteristics of habitats.

4DA601586381471EB6D71AB3985228B6.description: Habitat Management and Restoration: Develop a plan for the management and restoration of a specific habitat.

C7C77E20843A400C8DF06C8EBDE723DF.description: Describe the relationship between evolution and ecosystems.

8FFC92D3476845CB85392E9F37C066A3.description: Identify and describe impacts of native, non-native, and invasive species on an ecosystem.

8BAFB935966F497FAEF972FD964E986B.description: Select and implement restoration ecology practices to repair damaged ecosystems.

6670284CD2FF4BBDA8366EFDD737D767.description: Identify interactions of ecosystems to diﬀerentiate biomes.

C2FC14B75D8E41C488A6761C2ADD7F91.description: Describe biogeochemical cycles (e.g., carbon, nitrogen, phosphorous, hydrological) and their roles in maintaining equilibrium in an ecosystem.

22E65ACC783C480782597765F2316AA5.description: Connect biotic interactions with the abiotic environment.

65FBC199556C4D6DAF77B3EBD349EEA2.description: Describe the process of succession and its impact on ecosystems.

57DCEF83A5E44075A97E1429F5DEF169.description: Identify and classify interactions among organisms, including predation, symbiosis, and competition, to determine species interdependent relationships.

75FC10FE13F24C1A86FEC85D14DFF1BA.description: Distinguish the flow of energy through ecosystems.

ECE9AE692EC04C25A5BF72B21CE5C8C5.description: Describe ecological levels, including population, community, ecosystem, biome, and biosphere.

962DA80974404FACB2B8F6AEBA3D594C.description: Ecosystems: Evaluate biotic and abiotic components and relationships in ecosystems to apply restoration and conservation practices that maintain functionality.

3B718E21BA7144649CF71A17C4C6AB1C.description: Identify hazardous materials that can be recycled.

13539176CD4046A2A98DC663473E3673.description: Prepare and maintain hazardous material handling documentation.

21258BF12394486F9A5196A88B1B8B90.description: Identify and describe procedures to transport and store hazardous materials in accordance with regulations.

4773656F69324AD183DCE9E42E8589BE.description: Identify and describe collection procedures for hazardous materials and waste and interpret results.

F3D0FEB96D18476894A23A7F2DC93CF2.description: Perform site assessments to detect and identify the presence and storage of hazardous materials.

462DF22189834CC298A86F871DBFB8A6.description: Demonstrate safe management, handling, disposal, and recycling procedures for hazardous materials and waste.

768B82D9B36D411C8B5BBA24B18F291E.description: Locate and use information addressing hazardous substance discharge.

E04DF13B922A40FFB7B2FE815ADEAFB3.description: Demonstrate appropriate responses for major types of hazardous materials disasters.

9A6416A544B84BAF80E60A27783E4354.description: Describe health and safety practices for reducing risks from hazardous materials (e.g., safety data sheet [SDS], employer notification forms, personal protective equipment [PPE]).

1884A54B699C41B19A291A7EEBB41F06.description: Identify and diﬀerentiate solid waste, hazardous waste, toxic waste, and radioactive waste streams.

76403A89E0C9404480FA408251079F99.description: Hazardous Materials and Waste Management: Follow and apply handling, storage, and recording procedures for hazardous materials and waste.

7AEE90E1B0CF40FC9709DB580FD8CD3D.description: Analyze environmental conditions that influence environmental response.

DA0B7298F68343BA91A478B603B258EE.description: Identify and contact local emergency response teams.

F7289BE8229848359BFAAA811FFE9F38.description: Identify and describe requirements to develop and implement various emergency response plans.

2520591B584749E7B14705CD45450134.description: Identify, describe, and recommend remediation strategies for the release of contaminant to soil, surface water, or groundwater.

9600AF204C484147B388BA1F56D1A750.description: Identify, comply with, and implement best management practices for contaminant control, remediation, and prevention (e.g., biological, sanitation, buﬀer strips).

792E4B1EE86444D7A37F40C33C52520E.description: Describe the environmental impact from both industrial and nonindustrial processes.

C79BC0EF5A13437281B9A918AD1BD877.description: Monitor noise and light pollution and recommend abatement measures.

6C7F1D2C57D84EA59157C5AA2E21B5A5.description: Monitor, analyze, and quantify levels of contaminants from point and non-point sources.

4AADCEFAE71841BFBC0C5B2C71FA99C4.description: Determine the types, sources, and impact of natural, human-made contaminants, and high-risk contaminants.

3141EA54B48A43CBBED164521466EA31.description: Collect, record, and analyze environmental samples and interpret the results.

27FA97055BAF4DD49412BEFB2C7D2593.description: Contaminants and Pollution Control: Assess an aﬀected area, determine the source and type of contaminant, and respond.

623ED940CFEE424ABD61B9058B34B483.description: Determine type and volume of solid waste generated by an operation or facility.

9C5738867621438BA75BE7D737325CD1.description: Evaluate site closure methods and post-closure monitoring.

CA870F5C7FFE474C8515D93B5378EFF8.description: Describe standard operating procedures and identify design requirements for specific purposes (e.g., landfill, lagoon, leachate treatment).

576048E0406346E1ABF89BBD61C6BE7A.description: Explain the control processes and potential uses for solid waste byproducts (e.g., leachate, ash, landfill gas, biosolids, methane, manure).

DD2B9F66B6794E8DAEC2CB5F4D5B4041.description: Describe and monitor solid waste disposal procedures and management procedures (e.g., composting, incineration, recycling, burial, bio-digester).

BED2F3607768455182C33513E8EEA306.description: Describe and monitor solid waste disposal procedures (e.g., landfill, compost).

D49208E6500C4751B7F3A703CFED198C.description: Compare the processes of aerobic and anaerobic waste decomposition.

92504A8F2FDD40E2A2A08504C90A803D.description: Determine an acceptable site for solid waste disposal.

B1501B9E91B6443E8FAA5118A5B235D1.description: Distinguish the risks associated with solid waste accumulation, utilization, and disposal.

1C0E15EF5D5646EBA052ED3B5140A382.description: Collect, analyze, and treat solid waste materials (e.g., livestock mortalities, manure, garbage, food waste).

908FF3014C5242B1AC0F914E6E1ABAFD.description: Solid Waste and Renewable Resource Management: Control and process solid waste using current and alternative technologies.

935C28A844254D33B398F3A959126CA1.description: Locate, identify, and inventory wastewater assets.

E8E96574A0074630BC54FCC2ACA4912C.description: Identify and describe methods for cross-connection and backflow prevention.

2284BFAC3152487BBEE4AC49E1905C2A.description: Describe the processes of wastewater treatment (e.g., mixing, coagulation, flocculation, disinfection, treatment system, eﬀluent disposal, solids management).

6099810D4EF544E8BFCA60ECE0190B76.description: Identify normal and abnormal conditions in wastewater collection and treatment systems.

717E80E83549444A9B913FD5E4620DE6.description: Identify, analyze, and reconcile the components of wastewater samples using industry-approved standard operating procedures.

5F713D89E8D64EC895342F7012906F42.description: Collect wastewater samples using industry approved standard operating procedures.

2CA71C1636E046569B8F3B8EE55E36DE.description: Identify the components of a wastewater treatment system.

7A658706F4C6467CBACB2DBAA31122C3.description: Wastewater Operations: Monitor the wastewater collection and treatment methods for a specific site.

21F000CA20744168BDC164A09D8780CC.description: Describe taste and odor control in water treatment.

96B6E4A5CEF74A5B842871A6A3877915.description: Monitor the control and treatment of chemical and biological contaminants (e.g., trihalomethanes, lead, bacteria, nitrates) in water.

3CC8CDE9F19C48AD89CB5A5424325A06.description: Monitor the water treatment process (e.g., aeration, flocculation, sedimentation, filtration, disinfection).

1E067EA561AB4C44882EB62FF94C411C.description: Describe components of a water treatment facility.

4CC76F4321D046F294AE3B139F86CCFB.description: Collect and analyze water samples to determine potability.

63BDAF8239E04EFA9AEA2CDDDD93648E.description: Identify and assess the characteristics of potable water treatment and the sources of water.

58CA290A5CAD4B6A921FEE973A528F69.description: Potable Water Treatment: Monitor the water treatment processes for potable water at a specific site.

35B01AE69F094F3A97CD212157BC5403.description: Identify and describe best management practices that conserve and sustain water.

DBAE3C746C9447D1B948CD477C939212.description: Identify and describe risk factors for potential surface water and groundwater contamination.

209A1199DE37458A96FA41CFDAE6E6D3.description: Identify and describe watersheds and their structures (e.g., flowing waters, still water, and upland areas.)

5244C7C2BB3148FFBFA2C0AC1C3BAB0F.description: Evaluate water collection, storage, and distribution systems (e.g., wells, ponds, runoﬀ, waterways, irrigation).

299240F92AC749F7964F83D1C71E8837.description: Interpret surface water flow measurements (e.g., stage, stage-discharge curve, peak stage, instantaneous flow, estimation of annual discharge).

8F020B1AC29D4800A3BA9E573B12F5F2.description: Identify and describe uses of surface water flow measurements (e.g., stage, stage- discharge curve, peak stage, instantaneous flow, estimation of annual discharge).

29B5CC0BEA9E492EAE71C8657D7C68C8.description: Identify and describe types of tests (e.g., Well Yield Test, Pumping Test) used to determine groundwater potential and discharge rates.

B6DCCCD508694527BAC28BABC4753A4F.description: Describe the geological and meteorological principles aﬀecting water supplies.

7B7F7ABCA1754B3FA15892534D25EBA4.description: Water Use and Management: Collect, analyze, and interpret data for a localized water use and management plan.

0187212C333C44B087DA5F92BAA2BB99.description: Identify and describe best management and industry (e.g., agriculture, timber production, construction) production practices that maintain or improve air quality.

7FD79EFE5DEA4216923CDAC4BE9CFAE6.description: Assess the potential for air contamination at a specific site.

2B8B98E8FAC544DCB7DF6EDE645DA8BA.description: Monitor and evaluate air composition, quality, and quantity with direct reading instruments (e.g., combustible gases, oxygen, ammonia).

D135CB7EB4654DB1932EBC72C84C35C8.description: Explain human and natural factors (e.g., transportation, farming practices, greenhouse gases, forest fires, volcanic eruptions) aﬀecting air quality.

069E3496C832442D941D7345F3C0A173.description: Analyze the importance of air quality to humans and other living organisms.

90C835CF47114B4581BBD412CF1C3837.description: Explain the eﬀects of carbon dioxide sequestration on air quality.

65E945486A254FEA8DECD2C302E56FA0.description: Explain biogeochemical cycles (e.g., nitrogen, oxygen, sulfur) and how they relate to the biosphere, geosphere, and atmosphere.

0C492E6717854BEDB704AB64F7E52C93.description: Determine the chemical and physical properties of air (e.g., composition, density, pressure).

5F1FF97F69E540828032123B47E38F47.description: Air Quality: Analyze, interpret, and manage the biological, chemical, and physical properties of air quality.

EA8C85BB143641EF9C73540C54910E66.description: Identify and describe best management and industry (e.g., agriculture, timber production, construction) production practices that maintain or improve water quality.

E8D4F95EA6BD4E46A643FA6BFC75F0E4.description: Monitor and analyze water quality and quantity.

6CE0569D7A9844728E8B4C73469C70DB.description: Explain the biotic and abiotic factors aﬀecting water quality.

2625067E23D448158C2FC7F0A5A9D7DF.description: Explain the hydrological cycle and how human and animal activity impacts the cycle.

7CB06DD7910E4545A7789CBFD481454B.description: Measure vegetation, temperature, turbidity, macroinvertebrate populations, and bacterial quality in lentic and lotic waters to determine water quality.

3658DB276E62442ABC40E28BA50BA36E.description: Measure pH, dissolved oxygen (DO), biochemical oxygen demand (BOD), nitrogen, and phosphorus in lentic and lotic waters to determine water quality.

89B704BC59EC41CA895488F8C3810748.description: Assess and explain the interactions between human activities and the Earth’s hydrosphere (e.g., septic systems, desalinization, point and non-point source pollution).

5903259E898B4B0288CCAC292BE61399.description: Water Quality: Analyze, interpret, and manage the biological, chemical, and physical properties of water quality.

A22B76DD89AF4CE29C92EBC8D916E9E4.description: Assess basic processes (e.g., slope stability, water control, earth material control, vegetative treatment, soil amendments) of soil reclamation.

C3B9E9BFFF654F6A8CEE00C688D7D7CA.description: Evaluate soil survey data and implement management decisions.

BA32B2D78F664F2589BE685063FC018C.description: Describe soil limitations in agronomic, urban, and natural resource practices.

75ABCB188DF14F6696912A067EC20CF5.description: Compare and contrast the causes and eﬀects of soil erosion.

49F2DB2604B3436293953F7E1DC4790E.description: Identify and describe soil conservation practices to reduce soil erosion and compaction.

79577918C4EC4BE29D84E1A4F6FD0EC0.description: Determine land use and identify land capabilities classes.

8FAC77A2B1664E37A43D48F3CF38A0A0.description: Identify and describe factors (e.g., climate, soil texture, mineralogy, soil organisms, drainage co-eﬀicient, land use, vegetation types, management practices) aﬀecting organic matter and its function in soil quality.

2ECDE094F2B647019BF9104B0472AAD3.description: Collect, test, and analyze soil samples for physical and chemical properties.

EBB6631BF94746E0A43CE663C0664B54.description: Describe the relationship among physical properties of soils.

7C62C44A0C244FE4BD1DC6829B45616B.description: Identify soil forming factors and explain how they produce variability in soils.

37461126AE004C46AEDD04F4A29CFF42.description: Soils: Apply knowledge of soil characteristics and soil information resources to overcome any existing soil use limitations while maintaining or improving soil quality.
